responses: DLSU-D stands for De La Salle University-Dasmarinas.

patterns: Are there dormitory inside DLSUD?
What are the dormitory facilities available at DLSU-D?
Can you provide information about the dormitory facilities at DLSU-D?
responses: DLSU-D provides dormitory facilities for both female and male students. The female dormitory facilities include 11 buildings, including a four-story building with 58 air-conditioned rooms accommodating 278 students. Each room has a private toilet and bath, beds with mattresses, closet, orbit fans, refrigerator, and study tables. The male dormitory facilities include a two-story building with air-conditioned rooms accommodating 23 students, each equipped with a private toilet and bath, beds with mattresses, closet, and study tables.

patterns: How is daytime class suspension handled at DLSU-D?
What is the DLSU-D protocol for canceling daytime classes?
Tell me about the procedures for daytime class suspension at DLSU-D.
responses: In case of daytime suspension, coordination transpires among the offices of the president and the three (3) vice chancellors. Announcements are made at least one (1) hour before class suspension through official e-mail and internet protocol. Office operations shall be suspended, and employees will be released from work thirty minutes after the class suspension. Announcements from other DLSU campuses are not applicable to DLSU-D.

patterns: Describe the upbringing of John Baptist De La Salle.
Tell me about the early life of John Baptist De La Salle.
Where was John Baptist De La Salle born?
responses: John Baptist De La Salle was born at Reims, France, over 300 years ago. He was the first son of wealthy parents, receiving the tonsure at age eleven and becoming Canon of the Reims Cathedral at sixteen.

patterns: What education did John Baptist De La Salle receive?; Tell me about the educational background of John Baptist De La Salle.; Describe the academic journey of John Baptist De La Salle.
responses: John Baptist De La Salle completed his theological studies and was ordained a priest on April 9, 1678. Two years later, he received a doctorate in theology.

patterns: Tell me about the impact of John Baptist De La Salle's teachings.
How did the work of John Baptist De La Salle continue after his death?
What is the legacy of John Baptist De La Salle?
responses: John Baptist De La Salle's legacy includes pioneering training colleges for teachers, reform schools for delinquents, technical schools, and secondary schools for modern languages, arts, and sciences. His work quickly spread throughout France and, after his death, continued to spread across the globe. In 1900, he was declared a Saint, and in 1950, he was made the Patron Saint of all those who work in the field of education.

patterns: What was the mission of John Baptist De La Salle?
Describe the goals of the Brothers of the Christian Schools.
Explain the purpose of establishing schools for poor boys by John Baptist De La Salle.
responses: Moved by the plight of the poor, especially children with little hope for the future, John Baptist De La Salle dedicated himself to establishing schools for poor boys. His mission was to provide quality education for those often left to themselves and badly brought up.

patterns: What is the meaning of grievance in DLSUD?
What is the definition of grievance in the handbook?
Tell me about the grievance definition at DLSU-D.
responses:
For purposes of this handbook, grievance is defined as any dispute between a student who stands as the aggrieved party and any member of the academic community who may be the subject of the complaint. A grievance shall be made in writing and duly signed by the complainant. The written complaint shall be forwarded to the concerned person/office for mediation.
1. A certain grievance can either be academic or conduct-related. A grievance is academic if it stems from any dispute relative to learning or particular performance in academic subjects. On the other hand, grievance is conduct-related if it stems from the way a person behaves.
2. The complaint, answer, memorandum, recommendation, and eventually the decision must all be in writing. Excerpts of all the proceedings shall be in writing and shall be signed by all parties concerned. All original records of proceedings shall be kept in the possession of the office or body hearing the complaint.
3. Grievance may be against a faculty member, co-student, administrator, trainer, coach, support staff, outsourced personnel, or parent.

patterns: What is the definition of 'Detachment' in the Accord?
What is a detachment in dlsud?
Can you explain how a detachment works?
responses: Detachment' is an organizational unit of duly constituted authorities, whether military or police, assigned in a fixed place, for the enforcement of the law or the discharge of their duties in the maintenance of peace and order within a designated area of authority.

patterns: Explain the meaning of 'Peaceful Assembly' as per the Accord.
What is Peaceful Assembly?
Can you explain the definition of Peaceful Assembly?
responses: Peaceful Assembly' means that the assembly is peaceful when no actual criminal acts and/or organized acts of disorder or violence are committed by the demonstrators to indicate an intention on their part to sow public disorder, or defy public authority.

patterns: Can you explain the meaning of a Student Assembly?
Define 'Student assembly' according to the Accord of Understanding.
What is the meaning of student assembly?
responses: Student Assembly' refers to any gathering, rally, demonstration, parade, or other forms of mass action conducted by bona fide students in a peaceful manner inside school campuses or other designated places.

patterns: What are the corrective actions for deliberate disruption of academic functions or activities?
What are the punishment for deliberate disruption?

Is the deliberate disruption of the academic function or any university activity, or any other intentional act which tends to create disorders, tumult, breach of peace, or any serious disturbance although not connected with any academic function or school activity, considered a major offense?
responses: The deliberate disruption of the academic function or any university activity, or any other intentional act which tends to create disorders, tumult, breach of peace, or any serious disturbance although not connected with any academic function or school activity, is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 2, 3, and 4.

patterns: Where should drivers park their vehicles?
Tell me about the designated parking areas for drivers at DLSU-D.
Are there any designated parking areas for drivers?
responses: Drivers should park their vehicles at the designated parking areas only.

patterns: How is abusive behavior or discourtesy dealt with at DLSU-D?
Tell me about the consequences of discourtesy towards DLSU-D officials, faculty, staff, and security guards.
Explain the disciplinary action for students displaying abusive behavior or discourtesy at DLSU-D
responses: Abusive behavior or discourtesy towards DLSU-D officials, faculty, staff, student formatores, and security guards shall be dealt with appropriate disciplinary action. DLSU-D takes such matters seriously to maintain a respectful and conducive learning environment.

patterns: What sanctions are specified for law enforcers violating the Accord?
What actions can be taken against students who violate the terms and conditions of the Accord?
What are the punishment for students who does not follow the dlsud accord?
responses: Law enforcers violating the Accord will be subjected to criminal/administrative prosecution and sanctions in accordance with the law. Students violating the Accord will face disciplinary action by the school authorities or relevant educational bodies and, if warranted, criminal prosecution.

patterns: Is disturbing vehicle alarm allowed?
Tell me about the violation for a disturbing vehicle alarm.
Is having a disturbing vehicle alarm considered a traffic violation?
responses: Having a disturbing vehicle alarm is considered a minor traffic violation.

patterns: Is it necessary to submit documents for LCDC perusal?
What is the process for submitting necessary documents for outreach programs?
What documents need to be submitted for LCDC’s perusal?
responses: For LCDC’s perusal, requesting groups should submit necessary documents.

patterns: Tell me about the violation for driving without a seatbelt.
Can I drive without seatbelt?
Is driving without a seatbelt a traffic violation?
responses: Driving without a seatbelt is considered a minor traffic violation.

patterns: What are the corrective actions for drug addiction and/or possession or use of prohibited and regulated drugs (without valid prescription)?
Is drug addiction and/or possession or use of prohibited and regulated drugs (without valid prescription) considered a major offense?
What are the punishment for using drugs?
responses: Drug addiction and/or possession or use of prohibited and regulated drugs (without valid prescription) is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

patterns: What is EBPSP?
What is the meaning of EBPSP?
responses: EBPSP stands for Enhanced Brother President Scholarship Program.

patterns: From what point in time do these provisions apply?
From when do the provisions apply?
When do the foregoing provisions take effect?
responses: The foregoing provisions shall supersede all previous IRRs and shall take effect on the first semester, AY 2023-2024, until Special Term 2024.

patterns: What scholarships are available for the children of DLSU-D employees?
Can you provide information about scholarships for dependents of DLSU-D staff?
Are there any scholarships for DLSUD staffs or employees children?
responses:
There are two scholarships for the dependents of DLSU-D employees:
1. **Enhanced Brother President Scholarship Program (EBPSP):** This scholarship covers tuition fee discounts for three (3) dependent children of DLSU-D employees with the following scheme: 1st child receives a 100% tuition fee discount, 2nd child receives a 75% tuition fee discount, and 3rd child receives a 50% tuition fee discount.
2. **May 1988 Scholarship for Legal Dependents:** All legitimate children of staff who were regular employees as of May 31, 1988, are entitled to a scholarship equivalent to 100% tuition fee discount in any degree or non-degree program at DLSU-D. Grantees must finish the enrolled course within the normal number of school years required, and any additional expenses incurred beyond the normal curriculum are the responsibility of the DLSU-D employee.

patterns: How to apply for scholarship for the children of DLSUD employees?
How can the dependents of DLSU-D employees avail the scholarships offered?
What is the process for DLSU-D employee dependents to avail scholarships?
responses: The dependents of DLSU-D employees can avail scholarships through the Enhanced Brother President Scholarship Program (EBPSP) and the May 1988 Scholarship for Legal Dependents. The process involves application, validation by the Office of the University Registrar (OUR), approval by the Associate Vice Chancellor for Academic Services (AVCAS), notification to grantees, and final assessment/payment at the accounting office.

patterns: How many enabling assessments are required per term?
What is the submission policy for enabling assessments?
How are Enabling Assessments defined in the policy?
What are the guidelines regarding the submission of enabling assessments?
What is the stipulated number of enabling assessments per term?
What is an enabling assessment?
What is the minimum and maximum number of enabling assessments per term?
What are the guidelines for enabling assessments?
What are Enabling Assessments?
responses: Enabling Assessments are graded tasks per module that students need to complete.

There shall be a minimum of three and maximum of five enabling assessments per term. When giving enabling assessments, a maximum of two enabling assessments shall be allowed during the week. A minimum of two attempts shall be observed when answering online enabling assessments. Online enabling assessments shall be uploaded on SB and shall be accessible to students for a minimum of one day for quiz type and a minimum of six days for output-based assessments.

There shall be a minimum of three and a maximum of five enabling assessments per term, and submission may be based on the discretion of the department. When giving enabling assessments, a maximum of two enabling assessments shall be allowed during the week.

There shall be a minimum of three and maximum of five enabling assessments per term, and submission may be based on the discretion of the department. When giving enabling assessments, a maximum of two enabling assessments shall be allowed during the week.

patterns: Is it possible for a student to request an extension for an online enabling assessment?
What is the procedure if a student fails to comply with an online enabling assessment?
Can a student request an extension for an online enabling assessment?
responses: In case a student failed to comply with the online enabling assessment, s/he may be allowed to ask for an extension from his/her teacher subject to the latter’s discretion.

patterns: How is the time allocated for online enabling assessments decided?
Who decides the time allotted for online enabling assessments?
How is the time for online enabling assessments determined?
responses: The time allotted to answer online enabling assessments shall be decided by the department concerned.

patterns: When is a student considered officially enrolled at DLSU-D?
When is a student officially deemed enrolled at DLSU-D?
What is the general policy for enrollment at DLSU-D?
responses: A student is considered officially enrolled at DLSU-D after making full or initial payment as determined by the Accounting Office.

patterns: What is the down payment required for enrollment at DLSU-D?
What qualifies a student as officially enrolled at DLSU-D?
How is a student considered enrolled at DLSU-D?
responses: A student is considered enrolled at DLSU-D if they pay at least the down payment during enrollment. The down payment required for enrollment at DLSU-D is 40% of the total assessment upon enrollment.

patterns: How many transactions are students allowed for changing their schedules at DLSU-D?
How many schedule changes are students permitted during enrollment at DLSU-D?
What is the limit for changing schedules during enrollment at DLSU-D?
responses: Students at DLSU-D are allowed up to a third transaction to change their schedules. Any excess transactions require the completion of the Enrollment Transaction Form, subject to the approval of the OUR.

patterns: Can you explain the steps to apply for the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D?
What is the application procedure for the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D?
How to apply for entrance scholarship at dlsud?
responses:
The application procedure for the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D involves the following steps:

1. Applicants apply online and submit the application form and confirmation receipt at CSA on the scheduled date of application.
2. The scholarship coordinator reviews all the submitted application credentials and subsequently submits all qualified applicants to the CSA Director.
3. The CSA director endorses the application credentials of qualified applicants to the OUR for validation and subsequently to the AVCAS for approval.
4. The scholarship coordinator informs the grantees following an announced schedule and procedure.
5. Grantees proceed to the CSA to present the original registration form and claim notice of the discount to be subsequently presented to the accounting office for final assessment and/or payment.

patterns: What if I am SHS rank one or rank 2?
Tell me about the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D.
Can you share details about the Entrance Scholarship program at DLSU-D?
responses: Entrance scholarships at DLSU-D are extended to Rank One and Rank Two grade twelve completers from DepEd-recognized senior high schools who belong to a batch of at least 100 completers/students. Rank One grantees receive a full discount on tuition fees, while Rank Two receive a 50% discount.

patterns: What are the requirements for the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D?
Can you provide information about the Entrance Scholarship requirements at DLSU-D?
What are the requirements for freshman scholarship?
responses:
The requirements for the Entrance Scholarship at DLSU-D include:
1. Printed application form and confirmation receipt
2. Principal’s certification indicating the applicant’s rank (1st or 2nd) and the number of completers in the batch
3. Photocopy of Form 138
4. Recommendation letter from the high school principal or guidance counselor
5. One (1) copy of the latest 2”x2” colored picture
6. One (1) long folder with paper fastener

patterns: What is ERMaC?
What is the meaning of ERMaC?
responses: ERMaC stands for Environmental Resource and Management Center.

patterns: What is the evaluation tool for teachers handling flex blended classes?
What evaluation tool is used for teachers managing flex blended classes?
How is the performance of flex blended class teachers assessed?
responses: For teachers handling flex blended classes, an evaluation tool shall be prepared in consultation with the HRMO. The tool will be based on the provisions of the revised CBL guidelines, covering aspects such as overall use of the SB and MS Teams, uploaded modules, synchronous sessions, and asynchronous sessions.

patterns: What are the requirements to have Excellent Distinction in non-degree courses at DLSU-D?
What percentage of total credits must be earned at DLSU-D to be eligible for Excellent Distinction in non-degree courses?
How many credits must be earned at DLSU-D to fulfill the requirement for Excellent Distinction in non-degree courses?
responses:
To have Excellent Distinction in non-degree courses at DLSU-D, a graduating student must meet the following requirements:
Cumulative GPA: 3.76 - 4.00
No grade below 2.50 or its equivalent in all academic subjects taken inside and/or outside the University.
Seventy-five percent (75%) of total credits must be earned at DLSU-D.
NSTP and INTRO subjects should be passed.

patterns: Under what conditions can students be excused from attending synchronous classes?
Are there valid reasons for excusing students from synchronous classes?
What circumstances warrant students being exempted from attending synchronous classes?
responses: Students shall be excused from attending synchronous classes if he/she has face-to-face classes on the same day.

patterns: Under what circumstances may a student be excused from scheduled synchronous classes?
What are considered valid reasons for a student to be excused from synchronous classes?
In what situations is a student eligible to be excused from scheduled synchronous classes?
responses: A student may be excused from scheduled synchronous classes due to valid reasons such as disruptions of internet connections, serious illness, death in the family, and any other reasons analogous to the foregoing.

patterns: What types of externally funded scholarships are available at DLSU-D?
Is dlsud offers externally funded scholarships?
Can you provide information about scholarships sponsored by external organizations at DLSU-D?
responses: DLSU-D offers various externally funded scholarships sourced through the office of the VCMEAA. These scholarships are granted to economically deprived students, subject to the approval of the student scholarship committee. Some of the externally funded scholarships include the Endowment Fund, Visitors and Brothers of the District of North Mexico, Term Scholarship, and scholarships from Government Agencies.

patterns: Is eating allowed inside a classroom?
Can I drink inside a classroom?
Can I eat or drink inside the classroom?
responses: Eating/drinking inside the classroom, unless permitted by the faculty-in-charge, is considered a minor offense.

patterns: Can you explain the eligibility criteria for faculty consideration?
Who are eligible for faculty consideration?
What is Section 23.1?
responses: Administrators and faculty members are encouraged to show understanding, consideration, and cooperation to students, regardless of their year level and/or affiliation with any accredited clubs/organizations/student councils. Eligibility criteria include students designated as official representatives to academic, athletic, or cultural contests/presentations within or outside the University and students facing family emergencies or critical medical emergencies.

patterns: How to report students who conducts hazing?
Is engaging in any of the acts prohibited in RA 8049 (Anti-Hazing Law) considered a major offense?; What is the corrective action for engaging in prohibited acts in the Anti-Hazing Law?
What are the procedures for reporting hazing?
responses: Engaging in any of the acts prohibited in RA 8049 (Anti-Hazing Law) is considered a major offense (violent acts). The corrective action for this offense is Corrective Action 5.

patterns: What happens if someone is under alcohol inside the university?
What are the corrective actions for entering the University while intoxicated?
Is entering or being in the University premises while in a state of intoxication/under the influence of liquor considered a major offense?
responses: Entering or being in the University premises while in a state of intoxication/under the influence of liquor is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 2, 3, and 4.

patterns: Can I use classroom equipments?
Are there restrictions on using classroom equipment?
Can I use classroom facilities?
responses: Improper/unauthorized use of classroom equipment (LCD monitor, projector, board, TV, aircon) is considered a minor offense.

patterns: What ethical standards are expected from DLSU-D students?
Describe the consequences for not meeting ethical standards at DLSU-D.
Tell me about the standards of responsibility at DLSU-D.
responses: DLSU-D students are expected to act in accordance with the Christian principles, traditions, and ideals of the Filipino nation. They must maintain standards of responsibility and dignity. Violation of these standards, such as engaging in unscrupulous activities or premarital sexual relations, will be dealt with accordingly under the rules of DLSU-D (see section 19).

patterns: What are the consequences of cheating in an examination?
What if a student caught cheating in exams?
Explain the penalties for cheating during an examination.
responses: Section 5.6 of the Student Handbook indicates that a grade of 0.0 in the examination is given if a student is proven guilty of cheating.

patterns: What are the specific considerations are given during exam day or exam week?
Can you explain the guidelines for students on examination days?
What are the expectations for students on examination days?
responses: Section 5.3 of the Student Handbook expects students to arrive on time during examination days. Consideration may be given to a student who arrives within the first 15 minutes, provided no other student has finished the examination and submitted both the questionnaire and the answer sheet.

patterns: What is the section of student handbook discusses the examinations?
Can you explain the details regarding examinations?
What section of the Student Handbook covers concerns about Examination?
responses: Section 5 of the Student Handbook covers the Examinations. It provides guidelines and regulations related to major examinations during regular semesters, special terms, and specific details about NSTP, PE, and Laboratory examinations.

patterns: Tell me about exclusion penalties at DLSU-D.
What is exclusion as a penalty?
Are there any exclusion in penalty?
responses: Exclusion allows the institution to exclude or drop the name of the erring student from the roll of students immediately upon resolution for exclusion was promulgated.

patterns: What is the meaning of expulsion?
What is expulsion as a penalty?
Tell me about expulsion penalties at DLSU-D.
responses: Expulsion is a penalty wherein the institution declares an erring student disqualified for admission to any public or private higher education institution in the Philippines.

patterns: What is FAG?
What is the meaning of FAG?
responses: FAG stands for Financial Aid Grant.

patterns: What are the requirements for Financial Aid Grant (FAG) and Student Assistantship Program (SAP)scholarships at DLSU-D?
How to qualify for Financial Aid Grant (FAG) and Student Assistantship Program (SAP)?
Explain the eligibility criteria for the Financial Aid Grant and Student Assistantship Program at DLSU-D.
responses: To qualify for the Financial Aid Grant (FAG) and Student Assistantship Program (SAP) at DLSU-D, applicants must be Filipino citizens, have a general average of 85% and above for incoming freshmen, and a general point average of 2.50 (80-82) without any failing grades for upperclassmen. Preferably, applicants should be Catholic, and the course to be taken should be listed in the priority courses of DLSU-D.

patterns: What can you share about FAG and SAP scholarships at DLSU-D?
What it means to have FAG and SAP scholarships at DLSU-D?
Tell me about the Financial Aid Grant (FAG) and Student Assistantship Program (SAP) at DLSU-D.
responses: The Financial Aid Grant (FAG) at DLSU-D offers either a 50% or 100% discount in tuition and laboratory fees. FAG grantees are required to render a minimum number of service hours in assigned offices. For 50% discount, 1st or 2nd-year students need a minimum of 90 service hours, and 3rd to 5th-year students need a minimum of 50 service hours. For 100% discount, 1st or 2nd-year students need a minimum of 180 service hours, and 3rd to 5th-year students need a minimum of 100 service hours.

patterns: What are the service hour requirements for FAG grantees at DLSU-D?
Can you explain the service hour commitments for FAG scholarships?
How long is the service hour requirements for Financial Aid Grantees?
responses: FAG grantees at DLSU-D have varying service hour requirements. For 50% discount, 1st or 2nd-year students need a minimum of 90 service hours, and 3rd to 5th-year students need a minimum of 50 service hours. For 100% discount, 1st or 2nd-year students need a minimum of 180 service hours, and 3rd to 5th-year students need a minimum of 100 service hours.

patterns: Is there a penalty for failing to take the final exam?
Is there a penalty for not taking the final exam?
What happens if a student doesn't take the final exam?
What happens if a student fails to take the final examination?
responses: A grade of 0.00 will be automatically given by the faculty to the student two (2) weeks after the last day of the final special examination schedule if the student fails to take the final examination and/or accomplish other work/task prescribed for the course.

patterns: What factors contribute to receiving a Failed grade?
What are the reasons for receiving a Failed grade?
When is a final grade of 0.00 (Failed) given?
What factors lead to receiving a Failed grade?
responses:
A final grade of 0.00 (Failed) is given for the following reasons:
1. Inability to satisfy the minimum requirements of the subject/s
2. Excessive absences

patterns: What is the meaning of FAST?
What is FAST?
responses: FAST stands for Financial Aid for Student Trainee.

patterns: Can you share details about the FAST scholarship program at DLSU-D?
Are there any financial aid or scholarships for Student Trainees?
Tell me about the Financial Aid for Student Trainees (FAST) at DLSU-D.
responses: The Financial Aid for Student Trainees (FAST) at DLSU-D provides tuition fee adjustment per semester for grantees. Applicants must have no failing grade in any subject, and the number of grantees is based on the availability of funds. Grantees are required to provide assistance in the execution of enrollment procedures and policies.

patterns: Can you provide information about the eligibility requirements for FAST scholarships at DLSU-D?
What are the requirements for Financial Aid for Student Trainees scholarship?
What are the eligibility criteria for the Financial Aid for Student Trainees (FAST) at DLSU-D?
responses: To qualify for the Financial Aid for Student Trainees (FAST) at DLSU-D, applicants must have no failing grade in any subject, though no specific GPA is required. Relatives up to the second (2nd) degree of consanguinity or affinity of any contractual, part-time, full-time permanent, and probationary employees of DLSU-D are not allowed to apply for FAST. The number of grantees is based on the availability of funds.

patterns: Which counters or offices accept fee payments from students at DLSU-D?
Where are the designated locations for students to pay their fees at DLSU-D?
Where can students pay their fees at DLSU-D?
responses: Students at DLSU-D can pay their fees at Counters 14, 15, or 16, accredited payment centers listed on the students' portal, or the Finance Office.

patterns: Can you give more details about the female dormitory facilities at DLSU-D?
Tell me about the accommodations in the female dormitories at DLSU-D.
Are there female dormitory inside the campus?
responses: The female dormitory facilities at DLSU-D consist of 11 buildings. The four-story building has 58 air-conditioned rooms accommodating 278 students. Each room has a private toilet and bath, beds with mattresses, closet, orbit fans, refrigerator, and study tables. Additionally, two other dormitory buildings with left and right wings have a total of 15 rooms, accommodating either two or four persons per room. Seven condominium units with 63 rooms can accommodate three persons per room, featuring private toilet and bath, beds with mattresses, chairs, refrigerator, clothes cabinet, study table, and a bookshelf.

patterns: What is the process for conducting summative assessments in flex blended classes?
When are output-based summative assessments given to flex blended classes?
How is the summative assessment conducted for flex blended classes?
responses: For flex blended classes, output-based summative assessment shall be given to students at least fifteen days prior to the scheduled Summative Exam Week. The number of attempts and duration when the summative assessment is accessible to the students and the time allotted to answer the summative assessment shall be determined by the departments concerned. Anything that has been agreed upon in the departmental level shall be discussed with students during their first day in class.

patterns: Is there a designated process for managing attendance in flex blended synchronous sessions?
Is there a specific process for attendance in flex blended synchronous sessions?
How is attendance managed for flex blended classes with synchronous sessions?
responses: For flex blended classes, teachers shall be required to e-submit within THREE days after the holding of synchronous session to the department secretaries concerned sheets which are downloadable from MS Teams. The submitted attendance sheets will then be submitted to the assigned checker of the department by the secretary.

patterns: How are face-to-face classes scheduled for subjects under flex blended learning model?
What conditions must be met for scheduling face-to-face classes in flex blended learning model?
What is the procedure for scheduling face-to-face classes in subjects under the flex blended learning model?
How many modules are required for flex blended classes?
What is the prescribed quantity of modules for flex blended classes?
Is there a specific range for the number of modules in flex blended classes?
responses: For flex blended classes, there shall be a minimum of three and a maximum of six modules per term or a total of 6-12 modules for the entire semester.

patterns: How are outputs treated in flex blended classes?
What is the equivalence of outputs for non-research subjects under flex blended classes?
How are outputs treated in non-research subjects within the flex blended classes?
responses: For non-research subjects under flex blended classes, outputs shall be equivalent to summative assessment, and these shall be clearly discussed with students during their class orientation.

patterns: What is the qualification for professors to conduct flex blended classes?
What qualification is required for teachers to handle flex blended classes?
What is the additional qualification required for handling flex blended classes?
responses: For those who qualify to handle flex blended classes, they shall have finished the SB Learning Path Level 5 by the end of the current academic year.

patterns: Can a video assessment be part of enabling assessments in flex blended classes?
What is the maximum number of video assessments allowed for flex blended classes?
Is it permissible for a video assessment to be included as part of enabling assessments in flex blended classes?
responses: As a general rule for flex blended classes, a maximum of two video assessments per term shall be observed. It can be a combination of enabling and summative assessments.

patterns: What is the meaning of a flex blended learning mode?
What is the Flex Blended Learning Model?
Which classes adopt the Flex Blended Learning Model and how is it structured?
responses: The Flex Blended Learning Model is adopted for research and OJT classes. Under this model, most of the meetings shall be online, synchronous, and asynchronous. There shall be two (2) face-to-face meetings, one during the midterm period and one during the final period.

patterns: Tell me about the food services at DLSU-D.
Are there any food services inside the campus?
What food services are available inside the DLSU-D campus?
responses: DLSU-D offers several food service areas on campus, catering to the needs of the community. These food services encourage the practice of 'CLAYGO,' which stands for 'Clean As You Go.'

patterns: How are students dealt with for violations?
How are violations by students addressed?
What are the consequences for students in case of violations?
responses: For students, the Student Handbook provisions shall apply in the event of violations committed by students.

patterns: How are teachers dealt with for violations?
How are violations by teachers addressed?
What are the consequences for teachers in case of non-compliance?
What is a fully onsite modality?
What modality is adopted for Laboratory courses and Physical Education courses?
How are Laboratory courses and Physical Education courses conducted according to the policy?
responses: A fully onsite modality shall be adopted for all Laboratory courses and Physical Education courses. This modality shall follow the policies and guidelines stipulated in the Student Handbook.

patterns: What are the guidelines for faculty considerations?
Can you explain the guidelines for faculty considerations?
What section of the Student Handbook covers concerns about the guidelines for faculty considerations?
responses: Section 23 of the Student Handbook provides guidelines for Faculty Considerations. It emphasizes that DLSU-D students are required to complete assessment tasks to demonstrate that they have achieved the learning outcomes of the units. If a student cannot complete an assessment task due to exceptional circumstances as defined in 23.1 and 23.2, they may be eligible for faculty consideration described in 23.3.

patterns: Cam a student leave a class if the faculty is late for 1 hour, 2 hours or 3 hours class?
Can you explain the guidelines for faculty / teacher / professor late arrivals?
What happens if a faculty member / teacher / professor is late for a class?
responses: According to Section 4.4.1 of the DLSUD Student Handbook, if a faculty member is late for a 1, 1 and 1/2, 2, or 3-hour class, students may leave the room after 15, 25, 30, or 45 minutes have passed, respectively. However, faculty members arriving late within the specified time schedule may mark students absent if they leave their classes earlier than the prescribed time.

patterns: Can a student still submit a pcf even exceeded deadline?
What happens if a student fails to submit an accomplished PCF within the indicated time?
Do students are required in submitting PCF?
responses: If a student fails to submit an accomplished PCF within the indicated time, they will not be allowed to join the on/off-campus activity.

patterns: Tell me about the rules for family drivers and the designated drivers' lounge.
Are family drivers allowed inside the campus?
What guidelines apply to family drivers on campus?
responses: Family drivers should stay only in the designated drivers' lounge. Bodyguards are not allowed to roam around the campus. They should also follow school policies and guidelines, including but not limited to no smoking, no gambling, no drinking of liquor, no littering, no playing cards, no peddling, and no bringing of deadly weapons or firearms inside the campus.

patterns: Explain the considerations given to students facing family emergencies or critical medical emergencies.
What is the guidelines for family medical emergencies?
How are students facing family emergencies or critical medical emergencies considered for faculty considerations?
responses: According to Section 23.1.2 of the Student Handbook, students facing family emergencies (e.g., sickness or death of an immediate family member) or critical medical emergencies/ailments are considered for faculty considerations. Instances require verification (e.g., submission of death/medical certificates, notarized affidavit of guardian, etc.) and endorsement by the student’s academic adviser and the College Dean or Associate Dean. Only family emergencies backed up by proof as indicated in the provision shall be honored.

patterns: What are the corrective actions for final conviction of a criminal offense?
Is final conviction before any court of any criminal offense involving moral turpitude considered a major offense?
What are the punishment involving moral turpitude?
responses: Final conviction before any court of any criminal offense involving moral turpitude is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

patterns: Please tell me about the guidelines for follow up in student insurance claim.

patterns: What is the procedure for GPA calculation?
How is the GPA computed?
How is the GPA determined?
What is the process for calculating the GPA?
responses: The GPA (Grade Point Average) is computed through the following procedure. Multiply the credit unit for each course by the corresponding grade point to get the equivalent points.

patterns: What are the steps to calculate GPA?
How is the GPA calculated in detail?
Can you explain the details of GPA computation?
responses:
The GPA (Grade Point Average) is computed with the following details:
1. Add all the equivalent points obtained by multiplying the grade point of each course by its credit unit.
2. Divide the total equivalent points by the total number of credit units during the semester.
3. Round off the result to two decimal places.
Example:
Course | Grade Point | Credit Unit | Equivalent Point
BIOL106 | 3.25 | 3 | 9.75
MATH111 | 2.75 | 3 | 8.25
ENG101 | 3.50 | 3 | 10.50
SOSC102 | 3.00 | 3 | 9.00
PHL103 | 2.50 | 3 | 7.5
FILI101 | 3.50 | 3 | 10.50
Total | 18 | 55.50
GPA = Total Equivalent Point / Total Credit Unit = 55.50 / 18 = 3.08 (rounded to two decimal places)

patterns: Can you explain the criteria for graduating with honors at DLSU-D?
How does a student qualify for graduating with honors at DLSU-D?
Explain the criteria for graduating with honors at DLSU-D.
responses:
To graduate with honors at DLSU-D:
11.1 Students who have maintained the required academic standards may be recommended by the Honors and Awards Committee for graduating with honors.
11.1.1 In order to graduate with honors, a student must not have a grade below 2.50 or its equivalent in all academic subjects taken inside and/or outside the University.
11.1.2 A student must have earned seventy-five percent (75%) of total credits in the DLSU-D.
11.2 Grades in NSTP and INTRO subjects are not included in the computation of the GPA, but these subjects should all be passed.

10.1.1 passed all the subjects specified in the curriculum of his/her degree program;
10.1.2 formally applied for graduation.
10.2 All candidates for graduation should pay the necessary graduation fee and be cleared from all accountability from the Accounting Office before participating in the graduation ceremony.

patterns: Describe the founding of DLSU-D.
Tell me about the history of De La Salle University - Dasmarinas.
When was DLSU-D established?
responses: De La Salle University - Dasmarinas (DLSU-D) was first established on July 18, 1977, in Dasmarinas, Cavite. It began as a private nonsectarian tertiary school named General Emilio Aguinaldo College (GEAC)-Cavite and was managed by the Yaman Lahi Foundation. The college started with the Division of Health and Sciences and the Division of Arts and Sciences, offering courses such as Education, Elementary Education, Secretarial Administration, Nursing, Foods and Nutrition, Midwifery, Radiologic Technology, and Business Administration Technical courses were later included to help the community youth who could not afford a four-year college education. In 1987, ownership and management were transferred to Frere (Saint) Benilde Romancon Educational Foundation, Inc., making it a Catholic institution and a member of the De La Salle University System. The college was then named De La Salle University - Emilio Aguinaldo College (DLSU-EAC). In 1992, the name was changed to De La Salle University - Aguinaldo and eventually became De La Salle University - Dasmarinas in 1997. Over the years, the university has expanded its programs and colleges, achieving excellence in regional studies and academic programs relevant to the CALABARZON area.

patterns: Tell me about the documentation required for applying for a new ID card.
Explain the application procedure for a new ID card at DLSU-D.
What are the steps for a student applying for a new ID card?;;
responses: To apply for a new ID card at DLSU-D, the student should proceed to SWAFO, accomplish applicable forms for lost, damaged, or updated ID card, secure a campus pass upon presentation of COR. The campus pass serves as a temporary ID for the day and should be surrendered to SWAFO in the afternoon or right after class/transaction. The students are given an allowance of three (3) consecutive days to find the missing ID before considering it as a lost ID card. However, if the student was able to find the missing ID card within the three (3) school days allowance, the number of days that the ID was declared missing shall then be counted as a left ID. Present a duly-notarized affidavit of loss to SWAFO to secure a referral form. This should be done before the expiry date of the three (3) consecutive days allowance. The referral form shall be presented at Counter 5, and the student pays the necessary amount for the processing of a new ID card. SWAFO provides the student with a campus pass until the issuance of a new ID card.

patterns: Explain the process of ID card confiscation at DLSU-D

responses: Persons in authority at DLSU-D have the right to ask or confiscate the ID card when a student violates a policy or regulation. The confiscated ID card is then surrendered to SWAFO, and the student may need to secure a campus pass.

In the case of changing or updating a course, the student surrenders the old ID card to SWAFO and applies for a new one to the OUR upon enrollment to the new course.

responses: To finish the INTRO program at DLSU-D and receive a passing grade, students are required to complete sixteen (16) hours. responses: Section 24.3 of the Student Handbook outlines the procedures for insurance claims. A student is entitled to a medical reimbursement when, by reason of injury, the injured requires treatment by a qualified physician or surgeon, confinement in a hospital, or the employment of a licensed or graduated nurse. The insurance company will pay the actual expenses incurred within the first fifty-two (52) weeks from the date of the accident for such treatment, hospital charges and nurse’s fees but not to exceed the amount stipulated in the insurance policy as the result of any one accident. The student or their representative should file their insurance claims within one (1) year from the date of the accident or injury.

patterns: Who is St. John Baptist De La Salle?
responses: St. John Baptist De La Salle was the founder of the Institute of the Brothers of the Christian Schools. Born at Reims in France over 300 years ago, he was the first son of wealthy parents. De La Salle received the tonsure at age eleven and became Canon of the Reims Cathedral at sixteen. After the death of his parents, he assumed the administration of family affairs, completed theological studies, and was ordained a priest in 1678. Two years later, he received a doctorate in theology.

responses:
The seriousness of the major offense committed, taking into account the mitigating and aggravating circumstances which are present, shall determine the gravity of the penalty or sanction to be imposed, which ranges from a minimum of 1 - 5.
Corrective Action 1 involves being under probation for 1 year.

patterns: What is the process for settling grievances at DLSU-D?
What are the guidelines for grievances in DLSUD?
Tell me about the mediation and procedural process for resolving grievances.
responses:
As members of a Christian academic community, grievances against any member of the community at DLSU-D are initially resolved through sincere dialogue and discussion. Formal procedures for settling grievances are only resorted to when initial discussions fail. In compliance with procedural due process, the following steps are observed:
1. The right to a hearing, including the right to present one's case and submit evidence.
2. The tribunal or body, or any of its judges, must act independently, considering the law and facts of the controversy, and not simply accept the views of a subordinate.
3. The tribunal must consider the evidence presented.
4. The decision must be based on the evidence presented at the hearing or at least contained in the record, disclosed to the parties affected.
5. The evidence must be substantial, meaning reasonable evidence accepted as adequate to support a conclusion.
6. The decision must have something to support itself.
7. The board or body should, in all controversial questions, render its decision in such a manner that the parties to the proceeding can know the various issues involved and the reasons for the decision rendered.

responses: The old procedure for clearance at DLSU-D involves the following steps: 1) Student fills out the Student Clearance Form available at the OUR. 2) Student secures the signatures of the unit heads indicated in the form. 3) Once completed, the student presents the clearance to the OUR to indicate the amount to be paid for the requested documents. 4) Student settles the fees at the cashier and presents the official proof of payment/receipt to the OUR. 5) The clerk in-charge stamps the release date of the document requested on the duplicate copy of the clearance.

patterns: What is the meaning of online activities?
What are Online Activities?
How do students engage with Online Activities according to the policy?
responses: Online Activities are assessments/tasks that students need to answer, complete, and submit online using the Schoolbook.

patterns: Can online enabling assessments be extended?
What guidelines should be followed for setting deadlines of online assessments?
Are there specific rules regarding deadlines for online assessments?
responses: Uploading and setting deadlines of enabling assessments shall not be allowed during Summative Assessment Week. During suspension of classes, all online assessments shall be extended. The number of days for extension of assessments shall be based on the number of days when classes are suspended. However, the deadline of submission shall not fall on Sunday or holiday.

patterns: Which platforms are used for the asynchronous and synchronous conduct of online classes?

Are there any specific platforms for online class?
responses: Schoolbook and MS Teams shall be used for the asynchronous and synchronous conduct of online classes, respectively.

patterns: What is the procedure if a student fails to comply with an online enabling assessment?
How long are online enabling assessments accessible to students?
What steps should be taken if a student fails to adhere to an online enabling assessment?
responses: Online enabling assessments shall be uploaded on SB and shall be accessible to students for a minimum of one day for quiz type and a minimum of six days for output-based assessments. In case a student failed to comply with an online enabling assessment, s/he may be allowed to ask for an extension from his/her teacher. The student may be allowed to complete the missed enabling assessment for a period of ONE day. The schedule shall be determined by the teacher concerned.

patterns: What is the procedure for conducting online summative assessments?
How long are online summative assessments accessible to students?
What is the duration for online summative assessments?
How are online summative assessments conducted?
What is the duration of accessibility for online summative assessments for students?
What are the key features of online summative assessments?
What are the guidelines for online summative assessments?
How long can I take my online summative assessment?
responses: Online summative assessments shall be uploaded on SB and shall be accessible for a minimum of one (1) day for quiz type and a minimum of 6 days for output-based assessments. An online summative assessment may come in two parts, but it shall follow the premise of provisions 6.9.4, 6.9.7, and 6.9.8. It shall likewise be stipulated in the course syllabus.

Online summative assessments shall be uploaded on SB and shall be accessible for a minimum of one (1) day for quiz type and a minimum of 6 days for output-based assessments. The number of attempts and duration when the summative assessment is accessible to the students and the time allotted to answer the summative assessment shall be determined by the departments concerned.

responses: OUR stands for Office of the University Registrar.

responses: If treated on an outpatient basis, the patient is provided with a certification of the medical condition.

patterns: Can graduating students be given an overload at DLSU-D?

responses: Yes, graduating students at DLSU-D may be given an overload. The maximum allowable overload is not exceeding six (6) units in excess of the normal load specified in the curriculum during the regular semester and three (3) units during the special term.

responses: The Office of the Vice Chancellor for Academics and Research (OVCAR) is directly responsible for the implementation and monitoring of the blended learning guidelines.

responses: Vehicles shall observe the speed limit of 20 kph within the campus.

patterns: Explain the requirements for students to be representatives of DLSU-D in contests, conferences, or other off-campus events

responses: Students may be allowed to participate in any off-campus activity, contest, play, band, choir, conference, congress, association, society, or group as representatives of DLSU-D or its recognized student organizations. patterns: Explain the categories of offenses at DLSU-D.

responses: At DLSU-D, offenses are classified into three categories: minor, major, and traffic-related.

responses: Offering anything of value to any member of the academic community in exchange for any undue personal gain or as a favor for the benefit of another is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

responses: Official announcements at DLSU-D may be posted on designated bulletin boards, the university website, electronic billboards, the official social media accounts, streamers, and other similar means upon the endorsement of the requesting unit heads to the MCO (Marketing Communication Office). All streamers should be made up of university-approved materials and pass through the MCO and other concerned offices.

responses: Overloading is considered a minor traffic violation.

responses: Students at DLSU-D can pay in cash or by check. However, if a check is returned by the bank for any reason, the student will no longer be allowed to pay by check, and a penalty will be imposed.

responses: PE stands for Physical Education.

responses: A student paying in installment basis at DLSU-D should pay the outstanding balance before the midterm exam to avoid penalties.

responses: The penalty for late payment of enrollment fees at DLSU-D starts on the first day of classes.

responses: All freshmen at DLSU-D are required to take eight (8) units of Physical Education (PE) subjects, and it should be completed at the end of the second semester of their second curriculum year.

responses: Student portals will be blocked for those who are not able to pay their accountabilities two (2) weeks before the start of the final examination at DLSU-D.

patterns: How should enrolling in prerequisite subjects be followed at DLSU-D?

responses:
Enrolling in prerequisite subjects at DLSU-D should be strictly followed. However, a student may be allowed to enroll in a subject and its prerequisite simultaneously under the following conditions:
1. When the prerequisite is a repeated subject
2. When the student is graduating at the end of the school term
3. When it is approved by the Office of the University Registrar (OUR)

responses: Yes, all new students at DLSU-D are required to undergo a pre-admission health examination scheduled by the CSA at the start of the school year.

responses: For medical consultation at DLSU-D, the student proceeds to any university clinic (JFH 108, GMH 114, and ULS). Dental consultation is available at the east clinic (JFH 108) and west clinic (GMH 114).

responses: The purpose of the blended learning policy is to identify the duties and responsibilities of teachers and learners in the delivery of blended classes and other activities. It aims to align with the university’s CARE Center Model and Learner Centered Framework.

responses: Persuading students to violate their Non-Fraternity/Sorority Agreement by inviting them to be members of any unrecognized fraternity/sorority or organization is considered a major offense (violent acts). The corrective action for this offense is Corrective Action 5.

responses: Plagiarism is considered a major offense (dishonesty). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

responses: Possession of deadly weapon/s is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

patterns: What are the details of the prescribed uniform at DLSU-D?
Describe the allowed and disallowed clothing items for the prescribed uniform at DLSU-D.
Tell me about the prescribed uniform for males and females at DLSU-D.
responses: For males, the prescribed uniform includes a white barong with the embroidered DLSU-D name, a plain white t-shirt (v-neck) inside (tucked), and black slacks. Customized polo barong, maong/denim jeans, cargo pants, sandals, and rubber shoes/sneakers are not allowed. Females should wear a white peach twill cotton blouse with embroidered DLSU-D name, emerald green slacks, and closed plain black shoes with at least one-inch heels. Customized blouses and skinny-type pants are not allowed.

patterns: What is probation as a penalty?
What it means to have a probation?
Tell me about probation penalties at DLSU-D.
responses: Probation is an alternative to suspension or expulsion. In this way, the student is warned that future misconduct will not be tolerated but is permitted to continue his/her education, as long as the misconduct stops.

patterns: What is expected in terms of decorum at DLSU-D?

responses: Propriety and prudence, especially in conduct, manner, or appearance, are expected at all times inside and outside DLSU-D.

Can I proselytize?

responses: Proselytizing is considered a minor offense.

responses: Provocation in any form that results in heated verbal argument or physical confrontation between students or group of students is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 1 and 2.

patterns: Tell me about the automatic crediting of rebates for freshman students at DLSU-D.

responses: Effective school year 2018-2019, rebates of freshman students at DLSU-D will automatically be credited to the next semester’s enrollment. They can be refunded upon graduation or upon exit from the University.

patterns: Can you provide information about the effective date of the 4% rebate on tuition fee at DLSU-D?

responses: The 4% rebate on tuition fee at DLSU-D became effective in the first semester of the school year 2013-2014.

patterns: Who is eligible for rebates on tuition fees at DLSU-D?

responses: Rebates on tuition fees at DLSU-D will only be given to those who paid in full the total enrollment fees, including additional transactions (adding/dropping with refund), on or before the last day of adding and dropping with refund. Students who are under financial assistance are not entitled to any rebate.

patterns: What is the rebate percentage for students paying in full upon enrollment at DLSU-D?
Is there a rebate for students paying in full upon enrollment at DLSU-D?

responses:
A student who pays in full upon enrollment at DLSU-D is entitled to a 4% rebate on the tuition fee, credited/forwarded to the next semester's enrollment.
The rebate for students paying in full upon enrollment at DLSU-D is 4% on the tuition fee.

patterns: How are recommendations and certifications from the university clinic used at DLSU-D?

responses: Recommendation and/or certification released by the university clinic should be used as a basis for faculty consideration of the student (see section 23.1.1).

patterns: Are synchronous classes recorded?
Is there a practice of recording synchronous classes?
What is the policy on recording synchronous classes?
responses: Upon agreement among the students, all synchronous classes shall be recorded by the teacher. Recordings of synchronous classes shall be made available to the students on MS Teams for viewing and review purposes. Students shall not be allowed to record the synchronous meetings.

patterns: Tell me about the recreational options for students at DLSU-D.
What are the sports or recreational facilities inside DLSUD?
What recreational facilities are available at DLSU-D?
responses: DLSU-D provides recreational facilities, including basketball, volleyball, and table tennis areas. There's also an Olympic-size swimming pool adjacent to the ULS, available for students, faculty members, and support staff. Additionally, a track oval football field has been developed to meet the increasing need for sports and athletics facilities.

patterns: How should the list of references be presented in modules?
What is the recommended format for presenting the list of references in modules?
What are the requirements for the references in modules?
responses:
The modules shall present the complete list of references:
- There shall be a minimum of five and a maximum of ten references.
- References shall be within the last five years except for canon, theory-based works, and seminal studies.
- References shall be a combination of e-books, published research and articles, and other online resources.
- Proper citation should be observed following the format prescribed by the college.

patterns: How does the referral system work at the DLSU-D university clinic?
Is there a referral system at the university health clinic?
Can you explain the process of referrals at the DLSU-D university clinic?
responses: The referral system at DLSU-D's university clinic ensures that all students are entitled to medical consultation during office hours. The university nurse inquires into the nature of the patient's ailment and informs the university physician. The physician examines, diagnoses, and prescribes appropriate management for primary cases. If specialized diagnostic facilities or equipment are needed, the patient is referred to an appropriate clinic, laboratory, or specialist for further evaluation and/or management. Only the University Physician can refer patients to De La Salle University Medical Center.

patterns: List the documents needed for a refund at DLSU-D.
What documents are required for a refund at DLSU-D?
Tell me about the required paperwork for a refund at DLSU-D.
responses: The following documents must be submitted: original registration form, original official receipts, and dropping form.

patterns: What is the refund policy at DLSU-D?
How are refund claims processed at DLSU-D?
When can a student be charged the full fees after withdrawal at DLSU-D?
responses:
Claims for refund at DLSU-D are made according to the CHED memorandum. For the regular semester, the student will be charged based on the total assessment using the following rates:
10% if the student drops during the 1st week of classes, 
20% if the student drops during the 2nd week of classes, 
100% if the student drops after the 2nd week of classes.
For the Special Term, the student will be charged 10% based on the total assessment if the student drops during the dropping period with a refund. The student must be cleared from all accountabilities before the application for LOA will be processed.

patterns: Tell me about the refund process at DLSU-D.

responses: Refund for excess payment for the semester, other than the rebates, will be processed only upon request.

patterns: Explain the timeline for refund release at DLSU-D.
Tell me about the schedule for refund releases at DLSU-D.
When will the refund be released at DLSU-D?
responses: The refund shall be released one (1) month after application in the form of check or cash (from petty fund for amounts below one thousand pesos (P 1,000)). Student’s refund can be claimed at counter 13 upon presentation of a valid ID. An authorization letter is necessary if another person will claim the refund. Photocopies of the valid ID of the student and the representative must both be presented.

patterns: What fees are encompassed within the term 'regular fees' at DLSU-D?

responses: The term 'regular fees' at DLSU-D includes tuition, laboratory, miscellaneous (registration, library, medical/dental, student service, athletic), and other fees related to enrollment.

patterns: Is there a specific training and performance requirement for the rehiring of part-time faculty?

responses: SB Level 3 and at least 80% grade in the monitoring results on the use of Schoolbook and regular use of MS Teams for synchronous classes shall be required for the rehiring of part-time faculty.

patterns: Can you explain the system support services provided by Research, Data Management, and Evaluation at the SWC DLSU-D?

responses: Research, Data Management, and Evaluation at the SWC DLSU-D provide system support services to maintain, enhance, and support the total operation of the program. This includes coordinating and providing needed resources for research endeavors of counselors, managing all relevant student information, and developing appropriate evaluation tools to assess the SWC program.

patterns: What guidelines should be followed when responding to students' queries/concerns?
How should teachers respond to students' queries or concerns?
How are teachers expected to respond to inquiries or issues raised by students?
responses:
The following guidelines shall be followed when responding to students’ queries/concerns:
- Teachers must be able to respond to students’ queries/concerns within 48 hours upon receipt of the same unless it falls on weekends or holidays, which shall be handled promptly the following working day.
- MS Teams chat, SB messages, and DLSU-D e-mail shall be used by students to send their queries or concerns to their teacher. SMS or any social media platform may be used by students to send their concerns provided that they strictly comply with data-privacy related laws.
- The time for sending queries by the students to his/her teacher shall be capped or limited. It may be discussed and agreed upon by the teacher and the students during the first day of class.

patterns: Can you provide information about the DLSU-D retention policy?
Tell me about the retention policy at DLSU-D.
What is the DLSU-D retention policy?
responses:
The DLSU-D retention policy is summarized as follows:
9.1 A student accumulating 24 academic units of failures by the end of the semester of any school year is considered ineligible to enroll in the succeeding semester. However, if there are only 30 academic units left before graduation, the student can still enroll, provided a de-loading of three (3) academic units is made to ensure better academic performance during the semester.
9.2 The corresponding units of subjects retaken and then passed with a grade of 2.00 or better shall be deducted from the accumulated units of failures. The failing mark, however, will still appear on the official transcript of records.
9.3 Each college has its own retention policy specifying the grade or GPA requirements per program.

patterns: What is the campus ministry for?

responses: The Retreat and Recollection Ministry at DLSU-D provides all students with spiritual formation through required retreats and recollections. The programs respond to the goals of holistic formation and developmental growth of the students, offering moments of prayer, reflection, and sharing. Different modules are designed for first-year to graduating students.

patterns: How to apply for Financial Aid Grand and Student Assisstantship Program in dlsud?
What are the steps to apply for FAG and SAP scholarships at DLSU-D?
Can you explain the application procedure for the Financial Aid Grant and Student Assistantship Program at DLSU-D?
responses:
The application procedure for the Financial Aid Grant (FAG) and Student Assistantship Program (SAP) at DLSU-D involves several steps:

1. Applicants apply online and submit all required documents at the CSA following a deadline.
2. The scholarship coordinator reviews the applicants' online data, home visitation report, evaluation form, and other submitted documents. Only qualified applicants are endorsed to the CSA Director.
3. The CSA Director accepts the list of qualified applicants and schedules a deliberation with the members of the scholarship committee.
4. The scholarship committee deliberates on the screened applications and endorses the results to the scholarship coordinator.
5. The scholarship coordinator releases the results following an announced schedule and procedure.
6. Grantees proceed to the CSA to present the original registration form and claim notice of the discount note, which is subsequently presented to the accounting office for final assessment and/or payment.

patterns: Explain the process for resolving student grievances against faculty at DLSU-D.
What is the procedure for handling student complaints against faculty members?
What are guidelines for complaints against a professor or faculty?
responses:
Student complaints against a faculty member are handled on a level-by-level basis following the order or hierarchy of the administration:
Class Adviser → Department Chair/Associate Dean → College Dean → OSS Dean → VCAR.
The Student Grievance Board (SGB) has official jurisdiction on cases filed by a student against any person enumerated in 20.2.3 if administrative remedies fail to resolve the complaint.
The SGB is composed of the following:
Chair: OSS Dean
Members:
- College Dean of the complainant-student
- College Dean of the student-respondent
- Representative from the USG
- Representative from the Faculty Association
- Representative from the POLCA.
Procedural requirements for filing and settling a complaint by level are as follows:
1. Student files the written complaints as endorsed by the adviser. For academic matters, the student must file within the semester the cause of the complaint, unless it is about the final grade. In this case, a student may file a complaint until the second week after the grades have been released.
2. The Faculty adviser conducts a one-on-one conference with the student/faculty/staff respondent within five (5) school days from filing of the written complaint. If the faculty adviser fails to resolve the case, s/he refers it to the department chair for a formal complaint.
3. If the department chair fails to resolve the case within five (5) school days, s/he refers it to the dean of the college, who then creates an ad hoc committee to deliberate on and resolve the conflict within 5 school days.
4. If the decision by the Department Chair/College Dean is not satisfactory to the student complainants, the case may be elevated to the SGB chaired by the OSS Dean.
5. The OSS Dean convenes the SGB, which deliberates and decides on the case within seven (7) school days. The decision of the SGB as chaired by the OSS Dean is appealable to the VCAR within five (5) school days from receipt of the decision.
Guidelines during hearings and deliberation of the SGB:
1. The OSS Dean acts as the chair and presiding officer during the hearing, starting the proceedings by reading the complaint and reply/ies filed before the SGB.
2. Once a decision is made by the SGB, all parties are furnished with copies of the decision. If the complainant is not satisfied with the board’s decision, s/he may move for a reconsideration of the case with the board within forty-eight (48) hours after receipt of the decision.
3. If the complainant fails to file an appeal for reconsideration within forty-eight (48) hours after receipt thereof, the decision becomes final and executory.

responses: DLSU-D places high regard on the safety of all members of the community, especially during occurrences of natural calamities (e.g., typhoons, floods, earthquakes) or man-made disruptions (e.g., transport strikes, coup d’etat). When such interferences occur and the need to suspend work and classes arises, the academic community follows certain guidelines:

patterns: Tell me about suspension penalties at DLSU-D.
What it means to be suspened?
What is suspension as a penalty?
responses:
Suspension, as a penalty, allows the higher education institution to deprive or deny the erring student from attending classes for a period not exceeding twenty percent (20%) of the prescribed total class days.
Preventive suspension may be imposed during an investigation, prohibiting the erring student from entering the university premises and attending classes, especially when the evidence of guilt is strong.
The responsible university official may decide on preventive suspension if they are morally convinced that the continued stay of the student would cause sufficient distraction to the normal operations of the institution or pose real or imminent threat or danger to persons and property inside the institution's premises.
The number of days that a student was preventively suspended for shall be counted as part of the possible sanction should they be found guilty afterward in the disciplinary case.

responses: What is the Testing and Inventory Service provided by the Student Wellness Center (SWC) at DLSU-D?; Can you explain the focus of psychological assessment/testing at the SWC at DLSU-D?

patterns: What is the timeline for uploading modules for both traditional and flex blended classes?
When should modules be uploaded for flex blended classes?
What is the timeframe for uploading modules for traditional and flex blended classes?
responses:
For flex blended classes, modules shall be uploaded on the Schoolbook at least a week before the target date of presentation. This is to ensure that materials are available for advance reading by the students.
For traditional and flex blended classes, modules shall be uploaded on or before the target week of presentation based on the schedule that appears in the syllabus.

patterns: What is the meaning of USG?
What is USG?
responses: USG stands for University Student Government.

patterns: Can you explain the structure of the USG at DLSU-D?
Who are the members of the USG at DLSU-D?
What is the composition of the University Student Government (USG) at DLSU-D?
responses:
The USG (University Student Government) at DLSU-D is comprised of two boards, each with distinct functions and membership:

1. **Executive Board:** It consists of eight (8) members, namely: president, vice president, secretary, treasurer, auditor, business manager, and two (2) public relations officers. These members are elected at large by bona fide students of DLSU-D.

2. **Legislative Board:** This board comprises seven (7) members representing the presidents of the seven (7) college student councils. Members of the legislative board are elected by bona fide students of their respective colleges.

The term of office for all USG officers begins on the first day of July and concludes on the last day of June of the following year. All qualified officers are entitled to reelection.

patterns: Under what circumstances can a USG or CSG officer be disqualified at DLSU-D?
What grounds lead to the disqualification of a USG or CSG officer at DLSU-D?
Can you provide information on the disqualification criteria for USG and CSG officers at DLSU-D?
responses:
The following grounds lead to the disqualification of a USG or CSG officer at DLSU-D:

1. Obtaining a failing grade in any subject enrolled during the semester before the term.
2. Obtaining a failing grade during the term of office.
3. Commission of a major offense.
4. Failure to enroll during the term.
5. Permanent physiological/psychological incapacity.

patterns: Who is eligible to run for USG or CSG positions at DLSU-D?
Can you list the requirements for individuals aspiring to become USG or CSG officers at DLSU-D?
What are the qualifications for aspiring USG and CSG officers at DLSU-D?
responses:
To qualify as a USG or CSG officer at DLSU-D, individuals must meet the following criteria:

1. Be a bona fide student of the University.
2. Carry a minimum load of 15 units. An appeal may be made to the SCE, certified by the college dean, if the load is lower.
3. Have at least one-year residency in the University upon assumption of office.
4. Not have been found guilty of any major offense.
5. Must not have a failing grade in any subjects enrolled during the semester immediately preceding the election.

patterns: What are the functions of the USG at DLSU-D?
What is the role of USG in the university?
Can you list the responsibilities of the University Student Government (USG) at DLSU-D?
responses:
The USG (University Student Government) at DLSU-D serves as the highest student governing body with various functions, including:

1. Official representation of DLSU-D students in all activities within and outside the University.
2. Mediation between the student body and any sector of the Lasallian community in resolving student-related disputes/differences.
3. Active involvement in promoting national awareness and consciousness among the students.
4. Recognition of CSG, HF, CSO, PAG, SCE, collegiate and/or departmental organizations, publications, and other recognized student groups as significant partners in serving, empowering, and protecting the rights of the students.
5. Fostering an atmosphere where critical thinking prevails.
6. Encouraging students to act as one in advancing their rights and welfare.
7. Regularly conducting consultations with students to properly guide their sentiments.

patterns: Are there tuition discounts for USG officers at DLSU-D?

responses: USG officers at DLSU-D may be eligible for up to 100% discount on tuition and laboratory fees, subject to the approval of the Scholarship Committee.

responses: Unauthorized collection of money, checks, or other instruments used as equivalents of money, in connection with any matter, property, or transaction pertaining to the University is considered a major offense (misconduct). The corrective actions for this offense are Corrective Action 3, 4, and 5.

responses: It is considered unethical for any student at DLSU-D to make any unfavorable act towards another, including discriminating remarks and actions. Violating this policy is unethical and will be addressed accordingly.

patterns: Tell me about the days and exceptions for wearing the prescribed uniform at DLSU-D
What is the schedule for wearing the prescribed uniform at DLSU-D?
Describe when students are allowed to wear civilian clothes or Lasallian shirts at DLSU-D.
responses: Students at DLSU-D are required to wear the prescribed uniform inside the university premises within the week, except during Wednesdays and Saturdays when they can wear civilian or Lasallian shirts. On Tuesdays, they can wear the college-prescribed practicum uniforms and/or corporate attire. There are specific rules for students with no classes or those with NSTP/PE subjects. Students who have no classes but are required to come to DLSU-D on days that are not wash days may wear prescribed civilian clothes with their ID card and bring with them their COR.Students with NSTP/PE subjects may wear their NSTP/PE t-shirts the whole day when these subjects are scheduled except during major examinations week. PE shorts are only allowed to be worn during PE classes within the subject's premises.

patterns: What are the goals of the university?
Tell me about the mission statement.
Describe the university's mission.
Explain the mission of the university.
responses: To realize its vision, De La Salle University – Dasmariñas strives to become a leading institution nationally and globally in the integral formation of the youth. This involves offering relevant, responsive, and community-oriented academic programs, research and extension services, and promoting a keen sense of history, arts, and culture. Following in the footsteps of Saint John Baptist De La Salle, the university continues to transform itself into a caring community guided by Gospel. values, with a fervent spirit of service, love for learning, and excellence through a holistic approach."

patterns: Explain the vision statement.
Describe the university's vision.
What is the vision of the university?
Can you tell me about the vision?
responses: The vision of De La Salle University – Dasmariñas is to be a Filipino Catholic University established and managed by the De La Salle Brothers and their lay partners. It aims to respond to the needs of the Church and the Nation for human and Christian education, particularly for the youth at risk. The university, guided by Lasallian values of Faith, Service, and Communion, seeks to participate meaningfully in social transformation by forming God-centered, people-oriented, and patriotic individuals who serve as responsible and professionally competent stewards of God’s creation.

responses: The Wealthy Hour - Growth Sessions at the SWC DLSU-D cover various topics such as boosting self-confidence, dealing with bullying, cultivating happiness, self-empowerment, overcoming sadness or depression, advocacy, life skills, and interests enhancement.

patterns: What is the timeframe for attending webinars as an assessment?

responses: Assessments in the form of attending webinars must be within the regular class hours and must not go beyond 8:30 in the evening. However, upon the agreement between the subject teacher and the class, attendance at the webinar may go beyond 8:30 in the evening.

patterns: How can currently enrolled students withdraw enrollment or drop all subjects at DLSU-D?
What is the procedure for withdrawal of enrollment or dropping of subjects for currently enrolled students at DLSU-D?
How can a student withdraw enrollement at dlsud?
responses:
Currently enrolled students who wish to withdraw enrollment or drop all subjects must get a dropping form from the OUR. Claims for refund conform to the CHED’s memorandum where students will be charged based on the total assessment. The following rates are used:
- 10% If the student drops during the 1st week of classes
- 20% If the student drops during the 2nd week of classes
- 100% If the student drops after the 2nd week of classes.

patterns: What happens if a student is a candidate for graduation or transferring but has not served the sanction for major offense?

responses: If the student is a candidate for graduation or is transferring to another school, but has neither served his/her sanction nor served the penalty for the major offense, and there is no other means to do so, withholding of diploma, TOR, and other school records/credentials for a period of one (1) year shall be imposed.
